Ingredients.2: 2 tablespoons butter, or more as needed

Ingredients.5: 2  roasted red peppers, drained and sliced

Ingredients.9: 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk (such as Thai Kitchen®)

Directions.1: Peel butternut squash. Cut in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Cut flesh into cubes.

Directions.2: Melt 2 tablespoons butter and coconut oil in a soup pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add squash, red peppers, red curry paste, ginger, and garlic. Mix thoroughly and cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Add extra butter if the pot dries out, to avoid burning onion or squash.

Directions.3: Pour coconut milk and skim milk into the pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer soup, stirring often, until squash is soft, about 25 minutes.

Directions.4: Pour 1/3 of the soup into a blender. Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend. Pour into a large bowl. Repeat twice more.
